required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Procalcitonin Level and the High Risk of Mortality in 30 Days in Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) Patient , Cases Series.
clinical_study.official_title: Procalcitonin Level and the High Risk of Mortality in 30 Days , in Critically Ill Patients Infected by SARS-CoV-2, Experience of a North African Hospital University , Cases Series.

brief_summary.textblock:
Background:
Procalcitonin (PCT) is a biomarker that has been proposed as a helpful tool in inflammatory Clinique cases specially patient with pulmonary bacterienne infection .
Materials and methods the investigatore had retrospectively reviewed the electronic records and lists of all 582 COVID-19 patients admitted on the ICU of Hospital university Mohammed VI , Oujda. Between 01 juin 2020 and 31juanary 2021 , and analyzed the relation of PCT value and mortality at 30 days until we can defined a cut off Procalcitonine to use as a marker of severity and high mortality .

detailed_description.textblock: Our objective is to assess the relationship between Procalcitonin and 30-day mortality in patients admitted to the resuscitation department of the Mohammed VI University Hospital Center, Oujda, Morocco, infected by the SARS COV 2 Virus .

primary_outcome.measure: Procalcitonin is a marker of mortality
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 8 mounths
primary_outcome.description: as a cutoff 0.5 ng/ml Procalcitonin could be used as mortality factors

clinical_study.condition: the Relationship Between Procalcitonin and 30-day Mortality in COVID Patients

arm_group.description: The invistagatore had analysed the Procalcitonine of patient that survived and the non Survived frome COVID infection in Intensive care departement

study_pop.textblock: -582 patient with the SARS COV 2 virus, in the Resuscitation Service of the Mohammed VI University Hospital Center oujda, MAroc

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of SARS COV2 infection needed admission in ICU .
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient under 15 ans
